alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Cave Creek, New River; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 345 PM MST... At 300 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Horseshoe Reservoir to near Round Valley to near Four Peaks to near Apache Lake. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, Apache Junction, Fountain Hills, Round Valley, Sugarloaf Mountain, Ballantine Trailhead, McDowell Mountain Park, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, Saguaro Lake, Canyon Lake, Goldfield Ranch, Desert Mountain, Camp Creek, Salt River Tubing Recreation Area, Rio Verde, Horseshoe Reservoir, Fort McDowell, Seven Springs and Tortilla Flat. This includes AZ Route 87 between mile markers 190 and 215. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Cave Creek, New River; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Mazatzal Mountains; New River Mesa; Rio Verde, Salt River
